doc.title: Marvell Technology Inc. (MRVL): In-line quarter and revenue guidance reflects modest Al Datacenter traction in the medium term; Neutral
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/Marvell Technology Inc. MRVL In-line quarter and revenue guidance reflects modest AI Datacenter traction in the medium t_2025-08-28

passages.text: Key stock takeaways: We expect the stock to trade lower following an in- line quarter with guidance that was in line with the Street on revenue, but modestly above on margins and EPS. We believe investor expectations were low heading into the quarter and positioning was likely cautious; however, we believe the lack of revenue upside in guidance reflects a lack of near- term traction for Marvell's Datacenter custom silicon products. From here, we believe stock performance is likely to hinge on the magnitude of Marvell's custom compute ramp in 2026. We remain Neutral rated on the stock as we think Marvell is likely to gain limited traction through 2026 as a result of content loss in its largest customer silicon customer (Amazon), and ahead of the anticipated product ramp with Microsoft. We could be more constructive on the stock if we gain more visibility into the company's Al revenue trajectory over the next two years.

Quarterly results were in line with the Street: Marvell reported revenue of \(\) 2.01\(bn, in line with GS and the Street (Visible Alpha) at\) \ \(2.01\) bn. Gross margin of \(59.4\%\) was slightly below GS at \(59.7\%\) and the Street at \(59.5\%\) . Operating margin of \(34.8\%\) was just below GS at \(35.3\%\) and the Street at \(34.9\%\) . Operating EPS of \(\) 0.67\(was in line with GS at\) \ \(0.68\) and the Street at \(\) 0.67\(. Data Center revenue of\) \ \(1.49\) bn was in line with GS and the Street at \(\) 1.51\(bn. Enterprise Networking revenue of\) \ \(194\) mn was well above GS at \(\) 186\(mn and the Street at\) \ \(185\) mn. Carrier Infrastructure revenue of \(\) 130\(mn was well below GS at\) \ \(145\) mn and the Street at \(\) 147\(mn. Consumer revenue of\) \ \(116\) mn was far above GS at \(\) 95\(mn and the Street at\) \ \(90\) mn. Automotive/Industrial revenue of \(\) 76\(mn was in line with GS and the Street at\) \ \(76\) mn.

Datacenter trends: Marvell's Datacenter business increased by \(3\%\) QoQ, driven by strength in its electro- optics business. Management expects its 3Q Datacenter segment revenue to be roughly flat QoQ, with a double- digit \((\%)\) QoQ growth in optics and connectivity offsetting a double- digit \((\%)\) decline in custom silicon revenue. However, Marvell expects a strong recovery in its custom silicon business in 4Q - with its overall custom silicon business growing in 2H relative to 1H. While we recognize the inherent lumpiness in the custom silicon business, we believe 3Q guidance of custom silicon revenue being down QoQ coupled with high competitive intensity at key customer accounts for Marvell is likely to further dampen sentiment on the stock.

Enterprise Networking and Carrier: Enterprise Networking and Carrier combined revenue of \(\) 324\(mn grew 2\% QoQ, below management guidance of mid - single - digit \% growth. We believe this was largely driven by lumpiness in Carrier revenue. Management guided combined revenue of these two segments to grow 30\% QoQ in 3Q, suggesting that the overall recovery of these segments remains on track.

3Q revenue guidance is in line with the Street, after accounting for the automotive divestiture. Marvell guided 3Q revenue in line with the Street, with gross margin and EPS slightly above. Revenue was guided to \(\) 2.06\(bn at the midpoint, which is in line with GS at\) \ \(2.13\) bn and the Street at \(\) 2.10\(bn after accounting for an estimated\) \sim \(60mn quarterly headwind associated with the divestiture of the automotive Ethernet business. Non - GAAP gross margin was guided to\) 59.75\% \(, in line with GS at\) 59.8\% \(and above the Street at\) 59.5\% \(. OpEx was guided to\) \ \(485\) mn. Non- GAAP EPS (ex SBC) of \(\) 0.74\(at the midpoint is just above GS and the Street at\) \ \(0.72\) . Management also mentioned that they would report all segment revenues excluding Datacenter on a consolidated basis starting in 3Q.
Estimate changes. We trim our EPS estimates by an average of \(5\%\) driven by lower revenues and gross margin relative to our previous assumptions (see detailed estimates below).

Price target and risks: Our 12- month target price of \(\) 72\(down from\) \ \(75\) reflects a 24X P/E multiple (vs 25x prior given slower growth assumptions) applied to our normalized EPS of \(\) 3.00\(. Key upside risks: (1) stronger - than - expected ramp in custom compute; (2) stronger - than - expected recovery in traditional businesses. Key downside risks: (1) slowdown in overall AI spending; (2) share loss in custom compute.

We remain Neutral rated on MRVL. We believe Marvell has potential to drive stronger growth in its Datacenter and AI portfolio over time. However, in the medium term we think Marvell is likely to gain limited traction through 2026 as a result of content loss in its largest customer silicon customer (Amazon), particularly ahead of the anticipated Microsoft product ramp. We could be more constructive on the stock if we gain more visibility into the company's AI revenue trajectory in 2026.
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research, Visible Alpha Consensus Data

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

Not Rated (NR). The previous investment rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this stock and should not be relied upon. Coverage Suspended (CS). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.
